name: Multi-Agent System Verification
description: Multi-agent system verification tests the safety and reliability of systems where multiple AI agents interact, coordinate, or compete. This technique evaluates emergent behaviors, communication protocol adherence, conflict resolution mechanisms, and whether agents maintain individual and collective objectives appropriately. Verification includes testing edge cases where agent goals conflict, communication fails, or unexpected coalitions form, ensuring the overall system behaves safely even when individual agent behaviors combine in complex ways.

example_use_cases.description: Testing a warehouse management system with multiple autonomous robots to ensure they coordinate safely without collisions, deadlocks, or inefficient resource contention.
Verifying that a distributed AI system for grid management maintains reliable power distribution even when individual agents disagree or receive conflicting information.
Ensuring a multi-agent cybersecurity system cannot be compromised through attacks that manipulate inter-agent communication or exploit coordination vulnerabilities.

limitations.description: Combinatorial explosion of possible agent interactions makes comprehensive testing infeasible beyond small numbers of agents.
Emergent behaviors may only appear in specific scenarios that are difficult to anticipate and test systematically.
Formal verification methods don't scale well to complex multi-agent systems with learning components.
Testing environments may not capture all real-world complexities of agent deployment, communication delays, and failure modes.
